cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.CG, cs.GT, cs.DM

Reasoning: The paper deals with optimization problems and their approximations, which are typically studied in computer science subfields such as algorithms, computational complexity, and discrete mathematics. The paper also mentions specific problems such as TSP, independent set, coloring, set cover, hitting set, clique, and long path, which are commonly studied in subfields such as data structures, computational geometry, graph theory, and combinatorics. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), followed by cs.CC (Computational Complexity), cs.CG (Computational Geometry), cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory), and cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics).
